intro.description:
A first-trimester guide to daily life activities

Congratulations on your pregnancy! One of the first doubts most women have is —
"Can I continue doing my routine activities?"

Here's a clear guide on what you can safely do, what needs precautions, and when to stop.

section_title: Check what/how much can you do?

topics.title: Cooking
topics.do: Cook in a well-ventilated kitchen, take breaks if you feel nauseous.
topics.dont: Lift heavy gas cylinders or large water-filled vessels.
topics.red_flags: Dizziness, fainting, or pain while cooking.

topics.title: Walking
topics.safe_to_continue: Yes, Recommended. 20–30 mins most days improves blood flow & mood.
topics.do: Walk at a comfortable pace, wear supportive footwear.
topics.dont: Walk on uneven surfaces or push beyond comfort.
topics.who_should_avoid: Women with spotting, threatened miscarriage, or advised rest.

topics.title: Jogging / Gym Workouts
topics.safe_to_continue: Yes, If already doing it before pregnancy – you may continue at a lower intensity.
topics.do: Stick to light/moderate exercise, stay hydrated.
topics.dont: Try new heavy workouts or contact sports.
topics.who_should_avoid: First-timers (who never exercised before), women with twins, placenta previa, or high-risk pregnancy.
topics.red_flags: Chest pain, heavy bleeding, shortness of breath.

topics.title: Climbing Stairs
topics.do: Take it slow, hold the railing.
topics.who_should_be_careful: Women with anemia, high BP, or vaginal bleeding.

topics.title: Household Work
topics.do: Sweep, cook, fold clothes, mild cleaning.
topics.dont: Lift heavy buckets, bend repeatedly, or mop on wet slippery floors.
topics.who_should_avoid: Women with bleeding, cramps, or doctor-advised rest.

topics.title: Sex
topics.safe_to_continue: Yes, in a normal pregnancy. Baby is protected inside the uterus.
topics.do: Choose comfortable positions, listen to your body.
topics.dont: Continue if it causes pain or bleeding.
topics.who_should_avoid: Women with placenta previa, bleeding, preterm pains, or previous miscarriages.
topics.red_flags: Vaginal bleeding, pain, watery discharge after sex.

topics.title: Driving
topics.do: Wear seatbelt properly (lap belt under belly, shoulder belt across chest), take breaks on long drives.
topics.dont: Drive for very long without stopping.
topics.who_should_avoid: Women with severe nausea, fainting spells, or high-risk complications.
topics.red_flags: Sudden pain, bleeding, dizziness while driving.

topics.title: Sleeping Position
topics.safe_to_continue: First trimester - any comfortable position is fine (back, side, even stomach). Second trimester onwards - recommend to sleep on your left side.
topics.dont: Stay flat on your back for long after mid-pregnancy.
topics.red_flags: Severe back pain, breathing difficulty in certain positions.

topics.title: Fruits, Milk, Nuts & Seeds
topics.do: Wash fruits well, drink pasteurized milk, add nuts/seeds daily.
topics.dont: Eat unwashed fruits, raw sprouts, or unpasteurized milk.
topics.who_should_avoid: Women with food allergies, lactose intolerance (may need alternatives).
